heaviest_rainfall.status: On 04 January 2025, a record rainfall of 36.8mm was measured, indicating an exceptionally wet day.  4.6mm per hour was recorded as falling at times during the 37.2 hour storm.

heaviest_rainrate.status: 27.0mm per hour was the maximum rain rate ever recorded on 02 September 2025, during a 15.0 hour storm which dumped 21.19mm of rain from the clouds.

longest_rain.status: The record duration for continuous rain was set on 04 January 2025, the storm lasted 37.2 hours with a total precipitation of 36.8mm and it reached 4.6mm per hour at times.

most_lightning.status: The most lightning strikes in one day since 11 April 2025 was 23 and it happened on 07 September 2025.

nearest_lightning.status: The nearest lightning strike was on 13 May 2025, at a distance of 4.97 miles.

storm.status: No storms are expected.  The last storm was observed on 07 September 2025 and continued for 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: At the moment, it is not a cold snap.  This year has seen 6 cold snaps; typically, 3.7 cold snaps happen every year.

extreme.status: The record temperature difference stands at 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C), set on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: There is no heatwaves at the moment.  This year has experienced 6 heatwavess, with an average of 1.9 per year.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was 18 July 2025, there have been only 62 tropical nights since 1973.

average.status: The current average wind direction is southerly (184°), which differs from the average south-westerly (234.0°) by approximately 50.0 degrees.    In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The largest wind gust ever was on 13 October 2012 with a value of 93.7 mph.

run.status: The top recorded wind run is 1754 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: To date, the maximum wind speed recorded was 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 10.7°C) and outside temperature (down 9.6°C) and more moisture-laden outside humidity (up 8%).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (up 884 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in feels like temperature (up 14.5°C), dew point temperature (up 9.4°C), outside temperature (up 11.9°C), and cloud levels (up 798 m) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 884.2m lower than yesterday, 291.8m lower than the past week, 797.9m lower than the past month.

Yesterday, cloud levels hit a low of 928m and a high of 5160m, averaging 1650.0m; the past week and month reported somewhat higher averages.
cloud levels.summary: Cloud cover will be variable, overcast at times.

summary.summary: Inside; comfortable and pleasant temperatures. Outside; chilly temperatures are forecasted. Also, low humidity will be noticeable and little or no wind. Showers, cloud cover will be variable, overcast at times, and it’s dim outside. The weather may change rapidly and become worse.
